definition: attempting nothing and accomplishing nothing (idiom); without any initiative or drive/feckless
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: And we cannot learn without doing.
sentences.chinese: 无所作为我们就不能学习了解。

sentences.english: Bellicose rhetoric most often serves as an excuse for inaction.
sentences.chinese: 好斗的言辞常常是无所作为的借口。

sentences.english: They man who makes no mistakes does not usually make any-thing.
sentences.chinese: 不犯错误的人往往也就是无所作为的人。

sentences.english: Heaven never helps the men who will not act.
And of course, passion keeps us from not finding excuses to do nothing.
sentences.chinese: 当然，有了激情，我们就不会为无所作为寻找借口。

sentences.english: Another risk of inaction could be regional war.
sentences.chinese: 无所作为的另一种风险可能就是局部战争。

sentences.english: If we do not act, we are going to find bad debt everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 如果俺们无所作为视而不见，呆坏账就会随处可见。

sentences.english: The government was not entirely inactive.
sentences.chinese: 政府并非完全无所作为。

sentences.english: The man who makes no mistakes doesn't usually make anything.
sentences.chinese: 不犯错误的人往往就是无所作为的人。

to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
unaccomplished/mediocre/feckless

to take a laissez-faire attitude
to shut one's eyes and stop one's ears/out of touch with reality/to bury one's head in the sand
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
ordinary/mediocre
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
(idiom) terribly busy/up to one's ears in work
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
